thread.title: EastEnders actor Ross Kemp reveals he has sympathy for Danny Dyer as details of rows between pair emerge
thread.title_full: EastEnders actor Ross Kemp reveals he has sympathy for Danny Dyer as details of rows between pair emerge

author: cgreenwood
title: EastEnders actor Ross Kemp reveals he has sympathy for Danny Dyer as details of rows between pair emerge
text:
TV Magazine CARTER VS MITCHELL EastEnders actor Ross Kemp reveals he has sympathy for Danny Dyer as details of rows between pair emerge 
Dyer was forced to take a break from the BBC soap after his hard-boozing lifestyle and work schedule left him exhausted Revealed BY CARL GREENWOOD 21st February 2017, 8:23 am ROSS Kemp has admitted he does have sympathy for Danny Dyer’s troubles – but failed to name him after details of their clashes emerged. 
The actor – who plays Grant Mitchell in the BBC soap – was asked his feelings on troubled Dyer’s pressures, but instead of naming him, he simply said he had sympathy for anyone in that situation. 9 EastEnders actor Ross Kemp reveals he has sympathy for Danny Dyer as details of rows between pair emerge 
The Sun exclusively revealed how Dyer had warred with both Mitchell brothers on the soap, having spats with both Kemp and Steve McFadden who plays Phil Mitchell. 
But speaking on Good Morning Britain , Ross ignored the claims and said: “I think the attention is something you have to balance along with the long hours there. 
“I have a sympathy for anyone who is in that job obviously and dealing with the pressures of it.” 
It comes as The Sun exclusively revealed a bombshell behind-the-scenes feud between Danny and EastEnders’ Mitchell brothers. 
He and Steve McFadden, who plays Phil, have been engaging in a behind-the-scenes feud that has divided the cast. 
The Sun can also reveal that Dyer has had a go at Ross Kemp, who plays Phil’s sibling Grant. Fame Flynet 9 Sources say the troubled soap star ‘wanted to punch’ his co-star 
Sources on the BBC soap claim Dyer, 39, told pals he once wanted to punch McFadden, 57, on set. 
A show insider spoke of a “huge amount of tension” between Danny, who plays Queen Vic landlord Mick Carter, and Steve. EastEnders Mick Carter and Phil Mitchell almost come to blows in the Queen Vic BBC Dyer also had a run in with co-star Ross Kemp (Grant Mitchell) at the NTA's BBC
